CSSMax.summary: The max() CSS function lets you set the largest (most positive) value from a list of comma-separated expressions as the value of a CSS property value. The max() function can be used anywhere a {{CSSxRef("<length>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<frequency>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<angle>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<time>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<percentage>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<number>")}}, or {{CSSxRef("<integer>")}} is allowed.
